is a practical diploma level data science course at IIT Madras that teaches

This course exposes you to real-life tools
tablescraper-selected-row 2: Courses teach you programming and data science. From statistics to algorithms to writing Python code to building models.
tablescraper-selected-row 3: But one critical subject that’s rarely covered is: what tools should I pick and how do I become proficient in them?
tablescraper-selected-row 4: These tools might not help your CV much. But they will make things easier in real life. For example, at school:
tablescraper-selected-row 5: You learn from pristine datasets. But in the industry, you’ll have to scrape them yourself.
tablescraper-selected-row 6: You learn how to train models. But soon, you’ll just pick something from HuggingFace.
tablescraper-selected-row 7: You learn to write a log parser over weeks. Instead, your boss writes a  +  script in minutes.
tablescraper-selected-row 10: “We lost the documentation on quantum mechanics. You’ll have to decode the regexes yourself.”
tablescraper-selected-row 11: In this course, we’ve curated the most important tools people use in data science.

tablescraper-selected-row 2: You need a  understanding of Python, JavaScript, HTML, HTTP, Excel, and data science concepts.
tablescraper-selected-row 3: Yes. Good data scientists are good programmers. Data scientists don’t just analyze data or train models. They source data, clean it, transform it, visualize it, deploy it, and automate the whole process.
tablescraper-selected-row 4: In some organizations, some of this work is done by others (e.g. data engineers, IT teams, etc.). But wherever you are,  of the time, you need to write code for all of this yourself.
